openings.name: Ruy Lopez
openings.description: One of the oldest and most classic openings. White aims to control the center and prepare kingside castling while putting pressure on Black's e5 pawn.

variations.name: Main Line
variations.moves: 1.e4 e5 2.Nf3 Nc6 3.Bb5 a6 4.Ba4 Nf6 5.O-O Be7 6.Re1 b5 7.Bb3 d6 8.c3 O-O 9.h3
variations.description: The main line of the Ruy Lopez leads to rich strategic positions.

variations.name: Exchange Variation
variations.description: White exchanges bishop for knight, simplifying the position.

variations.name: Berlin Defense
variations.description: A solid defense that often leads to endgame positions.

keyIdeas: Control the center with pawns and pieces
Develop knights before bishops in most cases

commonTraps.name: Noah's Ark Trap
commonTraps.moves: 1.e4 e5 2.Nf3 Nc6 3.Bb5 a6 4.Ba4 Nf6 5.O-O Nxe4 6.d4 b5 7.Bb3 d5 8.dxe5 Be6 9.c3 Be7 10.Nbd2 O-O 11.Qe2
commonTraps.description: White sacrifices a pawn to gain strong attacking chances.

openings.name: Sicilian Defense
openings.description: The most popular and best-scoring response to 1.e4. Leads to asymmetric positions and rich tactical play with chances for both sides.

variations.name: Open Sicilian
variations.description: The main line of the Sicilian Defense.

variations.name: Najdorf Variation
variations.description: One of the most analyzed and complex variations.

keyIdeas: Control d4 square with c5 pawn
Asymmetric pawn structure leads to imbalanced positions

commonTraps.name: Sicilian Trap
commonTraps.moves: 1.e4 c5 2.Nf3 d6 3.d4 cxd4 4.Qxd4 Nc6 5.Bb5 Bd7 6.Bxc6 Bxc6 7.Nc3 Nf6 8.Bg5 e6 9.O-O-O Be7 10.Rhe1 O-O
commonTraps.description: Early queen development can lead to tactical opportunities.
